summary: This bill, the Flood Insurance Tax Credit Act of 2025, proposes tax credits for expenses related to flood insurance. It amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow taxpayers credits for federal and private flood insurance premiums, with specified limits and income-based phaseouts. The bill defines different types of flood insurance expenses and includes provisions for inflation adjustments and the denial of double benefits. The amendments would apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
